messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change.

This doesn't seem right to me.
If things are up to date, then there's no need to clean them.
This is just going to do lots of work on every goinstall.
For example, it will recompile package math if the
installed package imports math, even when math is
up to date.

I'd be happy to see a --clean flag added to goinstall,
but I don't think this is the right default behavior.

Russ

subject: code review 2180042: goinstall: clean directory before install
